name: get_pto_balance
description: Retrieves the current available Paid Time Off (PTO) balance details (allotted, rollover, logged, upcoming, remaining) for the *requesting user*. Use this when the user asks about their *own* PTO balance, remaining PTO, or available vacation time.

name: get_users_on_pto_today
description: Gets a list of all employees who are marked as being on Paid Time Off (PTO) for the current date (today). Use this when asked 'who is out today?', 'who is on vacation today?', 'is anyone out?', etc.

name: get_upcoming_pto_by_name
description: Looks up scheduled future Paid Time Off (PTO) dates for a specific employee based on their name. Use this to find out when someone will be out of the office in the future.

name.description: The first name, last name, or full name of the employee whose upcoming PTO should be checked.

name: get_users_wfh_today
description: Gets a list of all employees who are marked as Working From Home (WFH) for the current date (today). Use this when asked 'who is working from home today?', 'who is remote today?', 'is anyone WFH?', etc.

name: get_upcoming_wfh_by_name
description: Looks up scheduled future Work From Home (WFH) dates for a specific employee based on their name. Use this to find out when someone is planning to work remotely in the future.

name.description: The first name, last name, or full name of the employee whose upcoming WFH should be checked.

name: log_pto
description: Logs Paid Time Off (PTO) entries in TargetProcess for the requesting user. The function uses the user's Slack ID to find their TargetProcess ID. The LLM MUST parse the user's request (e.g., 'log PTO for next Monday', 'log PTO July 1-5', 'log 4 hours PTO tomorrow') and construct the 'pto_entries' array. Each entry in the array MUST represent a single day with its date in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format. Expand date ranges into individual day entries. If hours are not specified, default to 8.

pto_entries.description: An array of objects, each representing a single day of PTO to log. Each object MUST contain a 'date' (string, YYYY-MM-DD format) and MAY contain 'hours' (integer, defaults to 8 if omitted). Example: [{'date': '2024-07-29', 'hours': 8}, {'date': '2024-07-30'}]

date.description: The specific date for the PTO entry, formatted strictly as YYYY-MM-DD.

hours.description: The number of hours for the PTO entry on this date. Defaults to 8 if not provided.
